listitem.para: uint8_t CAN_Init ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, CAN_InitTypeDef * CAN_InitStruct)
void CAN_DBGFreeze ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, FunctionalState NewState)
void CAN_TTComModeCmd ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, FunctionalState NewState)
uint8_t CAN_Transmit ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, CanTxMsg * TxMessage)
uint8_t CAN_TransmitStatus ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint8_t TransmitMailbox)
void CAN_CancelTransmit ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint8_t Mailbox)
void CAN_Receive ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint8_t FIFONumber, CanRxMsg * RxMessage)
void CAN_FIFORelease ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint8_t FIFONumber)
uint8_t CAN_MessagePending ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint8_t FIFONumber)
uint8_t CAN_OperatingModeRequest ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint8_t CAN_OperatingMode)
void CAN_ITConfig ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint32_t CAN_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
FlagStatus CAN_GetFlagStatus ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint32_t CAN_FLAG)
void CAN_ClearFlag ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint32_t CAN_FLAG)
ITStatus CAN_GetITStatus ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint32_t CAN_IT)
void CAN_ClearITPendingBit ( CAN_TypeDef * CANx, uint32_t CAN_IT)

section.title: void CAN_DeInit (CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
section.emphasis: Deinitializes the CAN peripheral registers to their default reset values.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_Init (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, CAN_InitTypeDef *CAN_InitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the CAN peripheral according to the specified parameters in the CAN_InitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
pointer to a CAN_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the CAN peripheral.
indicates initialization succeed which will be CAN_InitStatus_Failed or CAN_InitStatus_Success.

section.title: void CAN_FilterInit (CAN_FilterInitTypeDef *CAN_FilterInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Configures the CAN reception filter according to the specified parameters in the CAN_FilterInitStruct.

entry.para: pointer to a CAN_FilterInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information.

section.title: void CAN_StructInit (CAN_InitTypeDef *CAN_InitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each CAN_InitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: pointer to a CAN_InitTypeDef structure which ill be initialized.

section.title: void CAN_SlaveStartBank (uint8_t CAN_BankNumber)
section.emphasis: Select the start bank filter for slave CAN.

entry.para: Select the start slave bank filter from 1..27.

section.title: void CAN_DBGFreeze (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the DBG Freeze for CAN.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

new state of the CAN peripheral. This parameter can be: ENABLE (CAN reception/transmission is frozen during debug. Reception FIFOs can still be accessed/controlled normally) or DISABLE (CAN is working during debug).

section.title: void CAN_TTComModeCmd (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the CAN Time TriggerOperation communication mode.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: DLC must be programmed as 8 in order Time Stamp (2 bytes) to be sent over the CAN bus.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

Mode new state. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE. When enabled, Time stamp (TIME[15:0]) value is sent in the last two data bytes of the 8-byte message: TIME[7:0] in data byte 6 and TIME[15:8] in data byte 7.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_Transmit (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, CanTxMsg *TxMessage)
section.emphasis: Initiates and transmits a CAN frame message.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.
pointer to a structure which contains CAN Id, CAN DLC and CAN data.
number of the mailbox that is used for transmission or CAN_TxStatus_NoMailBox if there is no empty mailbox.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_TransmitStatus (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint8_t TransmitMailbox)
section.emphasis: Checks the transmission status of a CAN Frame.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
the number of the mailbox that is used for transmission.
if the CAN driver transmits the message, CAN_TxStatus_Failed in an other case.

section.title: void CAN_CancelTransmit (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint8_t Mailbox)
section.emphasis: Cancels a transmit request.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
Mailbox number.

section.title: void CAN_Receive (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint8_t FIFONumber, CanRxMsg *RxMessage)
section.emphasis: Receives a correct CAN frame.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
Receive FIFO number, CAN_FIFO0 or CAN_FIFO1.
pointer to a structure receive frame which contains CAN Id, CAN DLC, CAN data and FMI number.

section.title: void CAN_FIFORelease (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint8_t FIFONumber)
section.emphasis: Releases the specified receive FIFO.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
FIFO to release, CAN_FIFO0 or CAN_FIFO1.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_MessagePending (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint8_t FIFONumber)
section.emphasis: Returns the number of pending received messages.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
Receive FIFO number, CAN_FIFO0 or CAN_FIFO1.
: which is the number of pending message.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_OperatingModeRequest (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint8_t CAN_OperatingMode)
section.emphasis: Selects the CAN Operation mode.

entry.para: CAN Operating Mode. This parameter can be one of CAN_OperatingMode_TypeDef enumeration.

of the requested mode which can be
CAN_ModeStatus_Failed: CAN failed entering the specific mode
CAN_ModeStatus_Success: CAN Succeed entering the specific mode

section.title: uint8_t CAN_Sleep (CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
section.emphasis: Enters the Sleep (low power) mode.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
if sleep entered, CAN_Sleep_Failed otherwise.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_WakeUp (CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
section.emphasis: Wakes up the CAN peripheral from sleep mode .

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.
if sleep mode left, CAN_WakeUp_Failed otherwise.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_GetLastErrorCode (CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
section.emphasis: Returns the CANx's last error code (LEC).

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to select the CAN peripheral.

code:
CAN_ERRORCODE_NoErr: No Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_StuffErr: Stuff Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_FormErr: Form Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_ACKErr : Acknowledgment Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_BitRecessiveErr: Bit Recessive Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_BitDominantErr: Bit Dominant Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_CRCErr: CRC Error
CAN_ERRORCODE_SoftwareSetErr: Software Set Error

section.title: uint8_t CAN_GetReceiveErrorCounter (CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
section.emphasis: Returns the CANx Receive Error Counter (REC).

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: In case of an error during reception, this counter is incremented by 1 or by 8 depending on the error condition as defined by the CAN standard. After every successful reception, the counter is decremented by 1 or reset to 120 if its value was higher than 128. When the counter value exceeds 127, the CAN controller enters the error passive state.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.
Receive Error Counter.

section.title: uint8_t CAN_GetLSBTransmitErrorCounter (CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
section.emphasis: Returns the LSB of the 9-bit CANx Transmit Error Counter(TEC).

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.
of the 9-bit CAN Transmit Error Counter.

section.title: void CAN_ITConfig (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint32_t CAN_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified CANx interrupts.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

specifies the CAN interrupt sources to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be:
CAN_IT_TME: Transmit mailbox empty Interrupt
CAN_IT_FMP0: FIFO 0 message pending Interrupt
CAN_IT_FF0: FIFO 0 full Interrupt
CAN_IT_FOV0: FIFO 0 overrun Interrupt
CAN_IT_FMP1: FIFO 1 message pending Interrupt
CAN_IT_FF1: FIFO 1 full Interrupt
CAN_IT_FOV1: FIFO 1 overrun Interrupt
CAN_IT_WKU: Wake-up Interrupt
CAN_IT_SLK: Sleep acknowledge Interrupt
CAN_IT_EWG: Error warning Interrupt
CAN_IT_EPV: Error passive Interrupt
CAN_IT_BOF: Bus-off Interrupt
CAN_IT_LEC: Last error code Interrupt
CAN_IT_ERR: Error Interrupt
new state of the CAN interrupts. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: FlagStatus CAN_GetFlagStatus (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint32_t CAN_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified CAN flag is set or not.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

specifies the flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
CAN_FLAG_RQCP0: Request MailBox0 Flag
CAN_FLAG_RQCP1: Request MailBox1 Flag
CAN_FLAG_RQCP2: Request MailBox2 Flag
CAN_FLAG_FMP0: FIFO 0 Message Pending Flag
CAN_FLAG_FF0: FIFO 0 Full Flag
CAN_FLAG_FOV0: FIFO 0 Overrun Flag
CAN_FLAG_FMP1: FIFO 1 Message Pending Flag
CAN_FLAG_FF1: FIFO 1 Full Flag
CAN_FLAG_FOV1: FIFO 1 Overrun Flag
CAN_FLAG_WKU: Wake up Flag
CAN_FLAG_SLAK: Sleep acknowledge Flag
CAN_FLAG_EWG: Error Warning Flag
CAN_FLAG_EPV: Error Passive Flag
CAN_FLAG_BOF: Bus-Off Flag
CAN_FLAG_LEC: Last error code Flag
new state of CAN_FLAG (SET or RESET).

section.title: void CAN_ClearFlag (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint32_t CAN_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Clears the CAN's pending flags.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

specifies the flag to clear. This parameter can be one of the following values:
CAN_FLAG_RQCP0: Request MailBox0 Flag
CAN_FLAG_RQCP1: Request MailBox1 Flag
CAN_FLAG_RQCP2: Request MailBox2 Flag
CAN_FLAG_FF0: FIFO 0 Full Flag
CAN_FLAG_FOV0: FIFO 0 Overrun Flag
CAN_FLAG_FF1: FIFO 1 Full Flag
CAN_FLAG_FOV1: FIFO 1 Overrun Flag
CAN_FLAG_WKU: Wake up Flag
CAN_FLAG_SLAK: Sleep acknowledge Flag
CAN_FLAG_LEC: Last error code Flag

section.title: ITStatus CAN_GetITStatus (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint32_t CAN_IT)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified CANx interrupt has occurred or not.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

specifies the CAN interrupt source to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
CAN_IT_TME: Transmit mailbox empty Interrupt
CAN_IT_FMP0: FIFO 0 message pending Interrupt
CAN_IT_FF0: FIFO 0 full Interrupt
CAN_IT_FOV0: FIFO 0 overrun Interrupt
CAN_IT_FMP1: FIFO 1 message pending Interrupt
CAN_IT_FF1: FIFO 1 full Interrupt
CAN_IT_FOV1: FIFO 1 overrun Interrupt
CAN_IT_WKU: Wake-up Interrupt
CAN_IT_SLK: Sleep acknowledge Interrupt
CAN_IT_EWG: Error warning Interrupt
CAN_IT_EPV: Error passive Interrupt
CAN_IT_BOF: Bus-off Interrupt
CAN_IT_LEC: Last error code Interrupt
CAN_IT_ERR: Error Interrupt
current state of CAN_IT (SET or RESET).

section.title: void CAN_ClearITPendingBit (CAN_TypeDef *CANx, uint32_t CAN_IT)
section.emphasis: Clears the CANx's interrupt pending bits.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 2 to to select the CAN peripheral.

specifies the interrupt pending bit to clear. This parameter can be one of the following values:
CAN_IT_TME: Transmit mailbox empty Interrupt
CAN_IT_FF0: FIFO 0 full Interrupt
CAN_IT_FOV0: FIFO 0 overrun Interrupt
CAN_IT_FF1: FIFO 1 full Interrupt
CAN_IT_FOV1: FIFO 1 overrun Interrupt
CAN_IT_WKU: Wake-up Interrupt
CAN_IT_SLK: Sleep acknowledge Interrupt
CAN_IT_EWG: Error warning Interrupt
CAN_IT_EPV: Error passive Interrupt
CAN_IT_BOF: Bus-off Interrupt
CAN_IT_LEC: Last error code Interrupt
CAN_IT_ERR: Error Interrupt
